column4: Ok I have a Pentium D (dual core 64 @like 2.4 or so) with a Geforce 9400 and 1080 MKV files decode poorly with some choppyness on my system, The CPU should be more than enough to handle any 1080 recording and I have a wholly unnecessary 2 gig of ram, any suggestions for improving playback quality of MKV 1080 files?
Kaffine, Mplayer, Parole and Gnome Media Player
What player(s)? Are you using GPU acceleration (vdpau)? Do you have the latest drivers fro nVidi website?
- Latest Nvidia driver are incompatible with my kernel, not that it matter since this problem existed before the kernel upgrade anyway
Kaffine, Mplayer, Parole and Gnome Media Player
What system and kernel?
Xubuntu - kernel 3.0.1
This is strange. I have Ubuntu 11.04 running on a custom kernel 3.0.0, Pentium IV 3,GHz (Northwood, 512KB L2, HT, FSB533) and 7300GT and I can easily run a 12Mbps 108-p AVI.
Do you have ubuntu-restricted-extras installed?
You understand my confusion then
yes
What version of nVidia driver do you have?

I have notice that MKV's seem to be more demanding then AVI's or any other format - I do not have the Nvidia drivers because they are NOT compatible with my kernel . . . or perhaps my kernel configuration, wither way they crash my kernel
Then you have only the Nouveau open-source driver with a performance completely uncomparable to Forceware. I would still recommend trying 285.03 beta, and/or getting back to 11.04 if you run Oneiric.
- I am on 11.04, and there is NO WAY i need GPU acceleration to run these file the CPU has way crazy more power then it should need for this task
Is it the same with generic kernel? Where do you have this 3.0.1 from anyways - kernel pPA or a hand-made compilation?
Again - is it the same with the generic kernel, and where have you taken this 3.0.1 from?

- I am going to try to remain calm so please listen and perhaps you will understand - this issue existed BEFORE I upgraded kernels when I was using the most recent Nvidia drivers and GPU acceleration was enabled, I am not going to dicsuss my kernel because it is not the question I have. I want to know if you can direct me to a media player that perhaps has a very small resource footprint or perhaps some codec related opti
Sorry. Then I'm even more confused.
thank you for your concise amswer, to be fair I think they are mpgs
I'm out  of ideas and dead-tired
It appears to me that the answer to my questions lies else where so i shall spend my time investigating
Something might be bad with codecs. Try reinstalling the whole Gstreamer + plugins.
that seems like a worthy place to start
